definition: dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]

sentences.english: Flowing water and green grass witness your lover 's endless prattle.
sentences.chinese: 流水纏繞，小草依依，都是你訴不盡的情話。

sentences.english: Upon midnight, loving words are exchanged below the coconut trees.
sentences.chinese: 若午夜互訴情話於椰樹下。

sentences.english: You can email or text, romantically cute love quotes to your love mate to express your love gestures.
sentences.chinese: 你可以通過郵件或短信，把浪漫情話傳達給你的愛人。

sentences.english: The pitch dark shadows silent as lovewords from dead mouths.
sentences.chinese: 漆黑的影子平靜得像死人嘴裏纏綿的情話。

sentences.english: How good to listen sweet prattle how lets people unforgettable commitment.
sentences.chinese: 多麼好聽的情話，多麼讓人難忘的承諾。

sentences.english: Waist Drum in northern Shaanxi have lots to talk of love talk.
sentences.chinese: 陝北的腰鼓有說不完的情話。

sentences.english: Woven in the heart words you hear?
sentences.chinese: 織在心裏的情話你聽見了嗎？

sentences.english: The young couple are always occupied with endless whispers of love.
sentences.chinese: 那對年輕夫婦總是情話喁喁。

sentences.english: Women fall in love through their ear, and men through their eyes.
sentences.chinese: 情話會使女人墜入情網，男人則是因爲眼中的美麗。

sentences.english: Dazzling fireworks and the situation comes first, then you .
sentences.chinese: 璀璨的煙花和你悠悠的情話。

sentences.english: Under the eaves, last stop twittering swallow, love words.
sentences.chinese: 屋檐下，去年停留的燕子，呢喃着恩恩愛愛的情話。

sentences.english: George murmured words of love in her ear.
sentences.chinese: 喬治在她耳邊低聲說着情話。

sentences.english: Sing a love words, Draw a love picture.
sentences.chinese: 輕吟一句情話，執筆一副情畫。

definition: nonsense/rubbish/superfluous words/You don't say!/No kidding! (gently sarcastic)
friendly advice/words spoken on sb's behalf/a good word/kind words/words that sound fine but are not followed up with actions
angry words/sth said in the moment of anger
to enquire solicitously about sb's well-being (idiom)/to pamper
lit. to like the new, and hate the old (idiom); fig. enamored with new people (e.g. new girlfriend), bored with the old
to tease a woman by pretending to be displeased with her/to flirt with a member of the opposite sex/to banter flirtatiously
(of a couple) to be harmonious/to be each other's sunshine
to act in a fit of pique/to get in a huff/to be peeved
